avalancheActivity.highlights: Windslabs have formed after prevailing westerly winds and snowshovers.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Some snow has accumulated during SW-snowshowers since the 14th. Little snow in general and mostly some  windslabs in gullies and slopes facing N, NE and E. No snowpits have been done.

travelAdvisory.comment: Snow is present in all mountainous areas in Iceland. Wind slabs are likely to be found in most parts and will continue to form in NW-snow showers on Thursday and N- to NE- winds on Friday. Weak layers can still be found in North Iceland but thaw last week has strengthened the snow pack in East Iceland. No avalanches have been reported but whumpfing and cracking has been observed in Tröllaskagi.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Snow can be found in all parts and wind slabs are present in the mountains. They will continue forming in NW winds on Thursay and N- to NE on Friday. Persistent weakness in snowpits in N-Iceland.

weatherForecast.highlights: Stíf NV átt en úrkomulítið á fimmtudag. Snýst í hæga norðlæga átt á föstudag og hvessir svo með austanátt nær helginni.

avalancheActivity.comment: No reports of recent avalanche activity
avalancheActivity.highlights: Some new snow in the mountains after westerly winds, but also light variable or easterly winds. Chances of loose avalanches but small windslabs could also exist.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Some new snow in the mountains after westerly winds, but also light variable or easterly winds. Shallow snowcover and rocks in many places. Chances of loose avalanches but small windslabs could also exist. No recent snowpits from the area.

travelAdvisory.comment: Snow is present in all mountainous areas in Iceland. Wind slabs are likely to be found in most parts and will continue to form in NW-snow showers on Thursday and N- to NE- winds on Friday. Weak layers can still be found in North Iceland but thaw last week has strengthened the snow pack in East Iceland. No avalanches have been reported but whumpfing and cracking has been observed in Tröllaskagi.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Snow can be found in all parts and wind slabs are present in the mountains. They will continue forming in NW winds on Thursay and N- to NE on Friday. Persistent weakness in snowpits in N-Iceland.

weatherForecast.highlights: Spáð er snjókomu í fremur hægum vindi en svo hvessir lítillega af norðri. Ekki er spáð mikill uppsafnaðri úrkomu en lausasnjór getur skafið og safnast í vindfleka.

avalancheActivity.highlights: New forecast 21.des. Considerable amount of new snow building up in northerly winds.. Continuing snow showers and winds from the north and also west will further encourage wind slab formation in the next days.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Snow accumulated in depressions and hillsides after strong W winds after 14th. Dec. Winds have turned to north and considerable amount of recent snow. Woomp sound and shooting cracks near Dalvík early this week. There are weaknesses in the snow pack still and mountain travelers advised to travel careully in steep, snowy terrain.

travelAdvisory.comment: Snow is present in all mountainous areas in Iceland. Wind slabs are likely to be found in most parts and will continue to form in NW-snow showers on Thursday and N- to NE- winds on Friday. Weak layers can still be found in North Iceland but thaw last week has strengthened the snow pack in East Iceland. No avalanches have been reported but whumpfing and cracking has been observed in Tröllaskagi.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Snow can be found in all parts and wind slabs are present in the mountains. They will continue forming in NW winds on Thursay and N- to NE on Friday. Persistent weakness in snowpits in N-Iceland.

weatherForecast.highlights: Norðanátt með samfelldri snjókomu eða éljagnagi á fimmtudag en dregur úr úrkomu og vindi um tíma. Gengur í hvassa vestanátt með snjókomu aðfaranótt föstudags. Snýst í NA hvassviðri með snjókomu á föstudag. Hæg norðlæg átt og einhver él á laugardag

avalancheActivity.highlights: The snowpack has strengthened after rain and thaw throughout all elevations and subsequent freezing last weekend. Wind slabs are likely to form in all elevations during snowfall on Wednesday.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Warming and rain and subsequent freezing has stabilized older snow. Some dry wind slabs may be found in upper elevations and snow fall may cause wind slabs to form above the previous snow line at 400 m.

travelAdvisory.comment: Snow is present in all mountainous areas in Iceland. Wind slabs are likely to be found in most parts and will continue to form in NW-snow showers on Thursday and N- to NE- winds on Friday. Weak layers can still be found in North Iceland but thaw last week has strengthened the snow pack in East Iceland. No avalanches have been reported but whumpfing and cracking has been observed in Tröllaskagi.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Snow can be found in all parts and wind slabs are present in the mountains. They will continue forming in NW winds on Thursay and N- to NE on Friday. Persistent weakness in snowpits in N-Iceland.

weatherForecast.highlights: Snjókoma í hægum vindi á miðvikudagskvöld en snýr í hvassa NV-átt á fimmtudag og éljagang. Á föstudag má gera ráð fyrir éljagangi og hvassri norðanátt.
